 By way of instant application, prayer has been

 made on behalf of the applicant-petitioner for issuance of

 direction to the non-applicants/respondents to promote her

 pursuant to recommendation of the DPC held on 19th June,

 2023 (Annexures R-3 &4) annexed with the reply to the

 application filed by the non-applicants/respondents.

 Precisely, the grouse of the applicant-petitioner as

 has been highlighted in the application and further canvassed

 by Mr. Dilip Sharma, learned Senior counsel representing the

 applicant-petitioner, is that once perusal of meeting of DPC

 clearly reveals that promotion to the post of Reader-cum-

 Associate Professor was done on the basis of seniority list of

 Tutor issued in the year 2010, petitioner ought to have been

 promoted against the post in question alongwith other eligible

 candidates. He submitted that bare perusal of proceedings of

 .

 DPC suggests that though petitioner has been found to be

 eligible, but she is not being promoted for the reason that writ

 petition having been filed by her is pending adjudication. He

 further submitted that department being fully aware of the fact

 of
 that petitioner is fully eligible against the post in question

 though has kept one post vacant, but petitioner have been

 denied promotion for her having filed writ petition, which is
 rt
 pending adjudication before this Court.

 Reply to the application stands filed on behalf of the

 non-applicants/respondents under the signature of Special

 Secretary (Health) to the Government of Himachal Pradesh,

 wherein it has been categorically admitted that petitioner

 herein is eligible to be promoted against the post in question in

 terms of the seniority of Sister Tutors issued in the year 2010,

 but since there is a stay order passed by this Court in the

 petition at hand, she has been not promoted, but one post has

 been kept vacant.

 Having heard learned counsel for the parties and

 perused the material available on record, this Court finds that

 petitioner herein has approached this Court in the instant writ

 petition, laying therein challenge to the order of her reversion

 from the post of Lecturer to Sister tutor, but such order has

 been stayed, meaning thereby petitioner cannot be reverted

 from the post of Lecturer to Tutor, but definitely there is no

 stay with regard to further promotion, if any. Since non-

 applicants/respondents themselves have admitted in the reply
